poem:
"Morning Rituals of a Nothern King"

A goat-climbing king, morning-bathed in polar air,
His regime echoed in Canadian precision.
Mornings whispered in hues of royal flair,
An 11-minute health rendition.
A monarch, mortal yet majestic, meets the dawn,
His cancerous sky, oddly hopeful and sane.
Through his aging prism, life stretches on -
a peculiar ballet of strength and pain.
